Knox Mobile Enrollment 23.06 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 23.03 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 22.11 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 22.08 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 22.05 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 22.03 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 21.11 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.40 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.39 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.38 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.37 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.36 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.34 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.33 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.32 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.31 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.28 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.27 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.26 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.24 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.23 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.22 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.21 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.20 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.19 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.18 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.17 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.16 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.15 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.14 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.13 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.12 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.11 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.10 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.9 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.8 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.7 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.6 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.5 release notes Knox Mobile Enrollment 1.4 release notes

sections.title: Get support
sections.content: Get support. This section covers how to obtain and manage support resources and contact information for KME. Get support for KME Knox Mobile Enrollment support resources are available from inside the KME console by selecting Support from the left-hand navigation console. The Samsung KME support site has insightful FAQs and user guides to assist users with frequently asked questions and procedures for enrolling devices. The Release Notes section describes new features and functionality available with the most recent Samsung KME releases. If necessary, contact the Knox Support team if you are experiencing any issues during the enrollment of your devices. For more information, go to Samsung Support. For information on KME supported countries, go to: KME country availability. Updating support contact information During enrollment, end users can contact support if they have any issues. This contact information is provided when registering for Knox Mobile Enrollment, but can be periodically updated as contact information updates warrant. To update support contact information: 1. Log in to Knox Mobile Enrollment. 2. In the upper-right corner of the screen, select your username, and Default support information. 3. Enter the following End-user support information: Ensure the required Company Name and Support email address are entered accurately, as these parameters display on enrolled device screens and are an important end user resource for issue reporting. Company Name - Provide the name of the organization responsible for the end-user's device support. This is a required field. Company Address - Provide the address of the organization responsible for the end-user's device support. Support phone number - Enter the contact number of the company responsible for the end-user's device support. Support email address - Enter the email address of the company responsible for the end-user's device support. 4. Select SAVE to commit the updates to the end user support information.

sections.title: What is Knox Mobile Enrollment?
sections.content: What is Knox Mobile Enrollment?. Knox Mobile Enrollment is an automated and streamlined EMM enrollment tool that enables you to provision thousands of devices for enterprise management, with less hassle for both IT admins and device users. With our advanced staging and security options that flex to your needs, enroll work devices safely across any network environment or fleet size. Knox Mobile Enrollment is fully integrated with Samsung devices and services for an end-to-end experience.

sections.title: How much does it cost to use Knox Mobile Enrollment?
sections.content: How much does it cost to use Knox Mobile Enrollment?. Knox Mobile Enrollment is a free solution offered by Samsung and can be used without a license. Regular Knox Mobile Enrollment profiles allow you to configure EMM enrollment parameters and secure devices with factory reset protection. Furthermore, Knox Mobile Enrollment advanced profiles extend the functionality of regular profiles and provide additional device control and security. For more information, see Knox Mobile Enrollment advanced profiles. You need an active Knox Suite license to use the features of advanced profiles. 1 You can use Knox services once you are enrolled and your information is confirmed by Samsung.

sections.title: What are the prerequisites for using Knox Mobile Enrollment?
sections.content: What are the prerequisites for using Knox Mobile Enrollment?. Find out what you need to get started with Knox Mobile Enrollment.

sections.title: Certain certificates are required to access my company network. Can I install the additional certificates on my mobile devices through Knox Mobile Enrollment?
sections.content: Certain certificates are required to access my company network. Can I install the additional certificates on my mobile devices through Knox Mobile Enrollment?. Yes. Knox Mobile Enrollment allows customers to add a certificate to enable their internal network connections. Root or intermediate certificates can be downloaded and installed after creating a Knox Mobile Enrollment profile, but prior to EMM connectivity, which may require root certificates to proceed. The following certificate types are supported - CER, PEM, CRT, DER, and CA-BUNDLE (either inside a ZIP file or applied directly). Additionally, CA certificates are supported, not User certificates. Keep in mind, with Android 9 root and intermediate certificates are installed in the device's default keystore. With Android 10 and higher, root and intermediate certificates are installed in the VPN and App keystores as well as the device default keystore.

sections.title: Does Knox Mobile Enrollment support on-premise deployment or intranets?
sections.content: Does Knox Mobile Enrollment support on-premise deployment or intranets?. Yes, Knox Mobile Enrollment supports enrolling in locally hosted EMM, so your security and performance are tightly maintained. Even in on-premise environments with intranet, use Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct - a PC application - to enroll and configure devices remotely.

sections.title: What platforms, operating systems, and devices do Knox Mobile Enrollment support? And which specific versions does it support?
sections.content: What platforms, operating systems, and devices do Knox Mobile Enrollment support? And which specific versions does it support?. Knox Mobile Enrollment cloud and Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct support only Samsung Android devices. For the most up-to-date list of devices that Knox Mobile Enrollment supports, see Devices secured by Knox.

sections.title: What types of EMM does Knox Mobile Enrollment support?
sections.content: What types of EMM does Knox Mobile Enrollment support?. For supported EMMs, please visit the Knox partner solutions page. See Android Enterprise profiles to learn how you can manually enable EMMs that aren't on the list.

sections.title: How can I register devices to Knox Mobile Enrollment?
sections.content: How can I register devices to Knox Mobile Enrollment?. The following enrollment options are available to Knox Mobile Enrollment: Reseller uploads - Authorized Samsung resellers can directly upload purchased device IMEIs to Knox Mobile Enrollment on behalf of their customer(s). For more information on Knox Mobile Enrollment resellers, visit the Knox resellers page. Knox Deployment App (KDA) - KDA is an app available on Google Play that is uniquely designed to help streamline the enterprise deployment of Samsung phones and tablets running an appropriate Knox version. The KDA allows an enterprise IT admin to upload devices directly through Bluetooth and Wi-Fi Direct, without the assistance of a reseller. KDA runs on a designated primary device which is required to sign in to Knox Mobile Enrollment. The target device requires a special B2B menu activated by drawing a plus sign (+) gesture on the initial device setup screen. QR code - QR code gesture enrollment is an enrollment option for devices running Android 10 or higher. The QR code enrollment process begins by drawing a plus sign (+) gesture on the initial device setup screen. This opens a menu, which when selected, activates the device's camera in QR code recognition mode. Once a QR code is recognized, a Wi-Fi connection is made (if the proper credentials are contained within the QR code) and enrollment begins. If there are no Wi-Fi credentials within the QR code, then the user is prompted to provide them within the Wi-Fi setup screen.

sections.title: Where can I find the list of resellers that can support bulk device registration for Knox Mobile Enrollment?
sections.content: Where can I find the list of resellers that can support bulk device registration for Knox Mobile Enrollment?. For Samsung device purchases and a simple onboarding process, see the resellers participating in the Knox Deployment Program.

sections.title: Our devices are managed by an MSP. Does Knox Mobile Enrollment allow an MSP to use Knox Mobile Enrollment on our behalf?
sections.content: Our devices are managed by an MSP. Does Knox Mobile Enrollment allow an MSP to use Knox Mobile Enrollment on our behalf?. Yes. Your MSP can use the Knox MSP portal to act as your proxy with Knox Mobile Enrollment features, including device bulk enrollment. Customers with the legacy Knox Mobile Enrollment offerings can also choose to migrate to the Knox MSP portal.

sections.title: Where can I find the list of countries where Knox Mobile Enrollment is available?
sections.content: Where can I find the list of countries where Knox Mobile Enrollment is available?. Knox Mobile Enrollment is available in 110 countries worldwide so that customers can have the same device enrollment experience wherever they are operating. For details, please see the list of countries where we operate.

sections.title: Can I enroll devices brought from multiple locations with a single Knox Mobile Enrollment service?
sections.content: Can I enroll devices brought from multiple locations with a single Knox Mobile Enrollment service?. Yes, you can enroll multiple devices from multiple locations in a single place. However, please note that currently, there are two Knox Mobile Enrollment servers globally - one server for devices in the Americas 3 and a second server for the European Union (EU) and the rest of the world. Your Knox Mobile Enrollment admin account is tied to one of these two servers based on the country selected at the time of registration. For example, if you selected the US as your country during Knox Mobile Enrollment registration, then only devices from the Americas can be enrolled through this account. If you have devices from the EU or other parts of the world, then you will need to create a second Knox Mobile Enrollment admin account selecting a country outside of the Americas during registration. 3 Countries in North America and Central and South America.

sections.title: Can I enable Knox Mobile Enrollment by integrating it with the existing web console instead of using the Knox Mobile Enrollment console?
sections.content: Can I enable Knox Mobile Enrollment by integrating it with the existing web console instead of using the Knox Mobile Enrollment console?. Knox Mobile Enrollment (KME) APIs are cloud-based APIs that enable companies to integrate key Knox Mobile Enrollment capabilities into their own custom portal, providing them a single portal for managing profiles and resellers. Use cases include internal IT support portals and management consoles for customers. These APIs are RESTful and return JSON responses. For secure access, API consumers should use the Samsung Knox access token. You can see the guide on these REST APIs to identify the Mobile Device Management (MDM) solution used to manage enterprise devices.

sections.title: Do I need a Knox Suite license to create an advanced profile?
sections.content: Do I need a Knox Suite license to create an advanced profile?. No, a Knox Suite license is not required to create an advanced profile. When a device undergoes out-of-box enrollment and is enrolled in KME, active Knox Suite licenses, if any, are activated. In case no active Knox Suite licenses are detected before device enrollment, you can still create an advanced profile.

sections.title: What happens if I don't have a Knox Suite license at the enrollment stage?
sections.content: What happens if I don't have a Knox Suite license at the enrollment stage?. If an advanced profile is assigned to a device but there are no Knox Suite seats remaining in your tenant, you won't be able to use any of the advanced features that are associated with the advanced profile. Even if you successfully enroll with KME, since you don't have a Knox Suite license, it will automatically be enrolled with a regular profile instead. The device status becomes Enrolled (restricted).

sections.title: What is the relationship between advanced profiles and Knox Suite license assignments?
sections.content: What is the relationship between advanced profiles and Knox Suite license assignments?. The following table covers three scenarios for license assignments in Knox Mobile Enrollment advanced profiles: Scenario , Outcome , Device status - , - , - Devices with a Knox Suite license and available license seats. Devices will be activated with advanced profile functionality during the Out of Box Experience flow. Enrolled Devices with a Knox Suite license and unavailable license seats. Devices will not be activated with advanced profile functionality. Enrolled (restricted) Devices without a Knox Suite license , EMM enrollment and device settings will be applied successfully. Advanced profile functionality won't be available. Enrolled (restricted)

sections.title: What happens to my advanced profiles when my Knox Suite license expires?
sections.content: What happens to my advanced profiles when my Knox Suite license expires?. If you have devices with advanced profiles applied to them, you will lose access to the advanced profile features.

sections.title: How do I disable advanced profile features on a device?
sections.content: How do I disable advanced profile features on a device?. After assigning a regular profile on the console, you must factory reset the device to apply the regular profile settings to the device.

sections.title: Can I get support from you for any issues and questions I may run into with Knox Mobile Enrollment?
sections.content: Can I get support from you for any issues and questions I may run into with Knox Mobile Enrollment?. Samsung provides various KBAs in the Support section of SamsungKnox.com for customers to find solutions independently. For issues that can't be solved using our digital resources, you can sign up on SamsungKnox.com to send us inquiries or create support tickets. Learn how to create support tickets.

sections.title: Can I register in Knox Mobile Enrollment while staging the devices using Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct?
sections.content: Can I register in Knox Mobile Enrollment while staging the devices using Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct?. If the devices are registered in the Knox Mobile Enrollment console and staged by Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct without an internet connection, then the devices are prompted to perform a factory reset whenever they are connected to a public network. This behavior occurs because Knox Mobile Enrollment has higher priority than Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct. Avoid registering devices in Knox Mobile Enrollment if you have staged them using Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct.

sections.title: Updates to device search from 23.09
sections.content: Updates to device search from 23.09. Starting with Knox Mobile Enrollment 23.09, the device search functionality has changed. Learn more about how to query the device list. Starting with Knox Mobile Enrollment 23.09, users will find that they can no longer query the following properties when searching the device list: PROFILE, USER ID, MODEL, TAGS, ORDER NUMBER The device list now only supports searching by the IMEI/MEID and serial number of a device. This change was made to improve the performance of the device search. For the IMEI/MEID and serial number, partial strings are valid queries only if the substring matches the start of the identifier. For example, if you're filtering for a device with an IMEI of 123456789024687, then searching for 12345 would return it, but 8902 and 4687 wouldn't. The Samsung Knox Mobile Enrollment team is currently working to further improve the functionality of the device search. Workaround To perform advanced searches on a device list, download the device list and filter the CSV file.

sections.title: How do I change the information displayed on the Knox Mobile Enrollment device splash screen?
sections.content: How do I change the information displayed on the Knox Mobile Enrollment device splash screen?. To change the Company name, address or the support information that is displayed to users while initiating enrollment with Knox Mobile Enrollment, follow the steps below. 1. With your primary Admin account, sign in to SamsungKnox.com 2. On the Dashboard, click on Launch under KNOX Mobile Enrollment. 3. On the following page, in the top right corner, click on the account ID. 4. Click on Manage Support Information. 5. On the following page you can change the company name, address and Support email/telephone number.

sections.title: From ticket #29318 via Ticket to Help Center App
sections.content: From ticket #29318 via Ticket to Help Center App. Environment Devices being enrolled in Airwatch via KME in the EU region. Issue This is a known issue as the Airwatch apks are hosted by Airwatch in the US region. This can often result in, depending on network connections, the Airwatch apk downloads getting timed out and failing. Resolution Please contact Airwatch as they are the ones hosting the apks and we do not have any control over where they are hosted. If you would like to contact us, please login at SamsungKnox.com and submit a ticket.

sections.title: MDM Setup Guide for Knox Mobile Enrollment
sections.content: MDM Setup Guide for Knox Mobile Enrollment. This PDF guide provides step-by-step instructions on how to set up Knox Mobile Enrollment with the following MDMs: Samsung Knox Manage, VMware Workspace ONE, Microsoft Intune, BlackBerry UEM, SOTI MobiControl, MobileIron Core, MobileIron Cloud, IBM Maas360, Citrix XenMobile, FAMOC, 42Gears SureMDM, ManageEngine Mobile Device Manager Plus Click here to open

sections.title: AirWatch prompts for group ID to be manually entered during KME enrollment
sections.content: AirWatch prompts for group ID to be manually entered during KME enrollment. When KME launches the AirWatch MDM to begin enrollment, the device user is required to enter the group ID, even if the group ID is already provided in the "Custom JSON Data" field of the KME profile. Consequently, the device user must obtain the group ID from their administrator to complete enrollment. Cause The group ID within the "Custom JSON Data" portion of the KME console has been entered in an incorrect format. Resolution KME supports two types of profiles depending on whether your app is running as a device owner (DO) or device admin (DA). Ensure you have provided the correct group ID label in the "Custom JSON Data" for the profile type you have selected, as outlined below: For DO profiles: For DA profiles: Additional information For" more information on how to set up a KME profile for the VMware Airwatch MDM, go to the VMware AirWatch documentation.

sections.title: Knox Mobile Enrollment does not start on SM-G950W devices running Android N
sections.content: Knox Mobile Enrollment does not start on SM-G950W devices running Android N. When a new out-of-box device or device that has been factory reset is booted up, KME does not launch and the device proceeds to the Android setup wizard. The following dumpstate log shows the error that is returned: ```java 09-27 16:36:59.119 I/SBrowserFlags(4928): isSdpSupportedForWebPayments(): isWarrantyBlown == false … 09-27 16:37:17.575" 6558" 7053 E UMC:AsyncResponseCallback: GET_PROFILE:onFailure, statusCode:401 message:"} ``` Cause In SM-G950W devices running Android N, the attestation framework references the wrong memory address for the Real-time Kernel Protection (RKP) environment. The incorrect reference causes invalid values to be included in the affected blob, returning the above error and preventing KME from starting. Resolution This issue has been resolved in Android O and later. Please upgrade your device to the latest available version of Android. Additional Information To learn more about RKP, see the Samsung Knox blog post on Real-time Kernel Protection.

sections.title: User access blocked when assigning"a profile to devices
sections.content: User access blocked when assigning"a profile to devices. In KME, some users are encountering the following"error when assigning a profile to a device: ```json Your access to this service has been blocked. ``` Cause The user's account is missing the necessary permissions in KME. Resolution Only the Super Admin can check or change the permissions assigned to a role"unless other admins are also given the permission to view user roles. In KME, under Administrators & Roles, check that the role that the user is assigned to has the following permissions selected: #Devices and Uploads: Manage Devices Assign Profile Unassign Profile Manage Tag Device users: Manage"Device"User Add, edit, assign and unassign To add a new administrator and manage their roles, see the KME documentation on how to"invite and manage admins Additional information To learn more about how KME handles admin permissions, see Add an admin.

sections.title: Skip Setup Wizard not working when using Knox Configure"and Knox Mobile Enrollment"togethe
sections.content: Skip Setup Wizard not working when using Knox Configure"and Knox Mobile Enrollment"togethe. Some users are reporting that the "Skip Setup Wizard" feature is not working when the following conditions are met on the device: 1. Running Knox version 2.7.1 2. Enrolling with a KME"Device Admin profile with Skip Setup Wizard selected 3. Assigned a profile in KC Cause In KC, the""Skip Setup Wizard" feature is not supported until Knox version 2.8. As the enrollment process pulls down the KC profile first, the device complies with the"setup preferences in the KC profile"instead of the KME preferences. You can find your device's Knox version"by navigating to Settings > About Phone > Software Information > Knox Version. Workaround If Skip Setup Wizard is needed, ensure that the device is only assigned to the KME profile when enrolling. After the device is enrolled in KME, assign the device to KC and configure the device by navigating to configure.samsungknox.com and selecting "First-Time"Enrollment'.

sections.title: End of Service - Airwatch/VMware ELM Service application
sections.content: End of Service - Airwatch/VMware ELM Service application. On August 9th, 2020, VMware Workspace ONE Intelligent Hub's Enterprise Licensing Management (ELM)"Service application is reaching End of Service (EoS). After this date, the following"public download URL will be unavailable for Samsung Knox Mobile Enrollment (KME) users: ```json https://discovery.awmdm.com/mobileenrollment/SamsungELMService.apk" ``` How will this affect Knox Mobile Enrollment"users? As a KME user, you can no longer use the Samsung ELM Service download URL."Customers using the above"URL in their legacy Device Administrator (DA) profiles must remove it from"their KME enrollment profile. Ensure the URL is removed before the EoS date on August 9th, 2020, or your devices will fail to enroll. If a device is currently enrolled with a profile that includes the URL, it remains unaffected unless it is factory reset. Additional Information For more about the VMware ELM service"deprecation , p lease see the VMware"knowledge base article.

sections.title: Samsung Email and Samsung Browser apps are installed even with "Disable system apps" enabled
sections.content: Samsung Email and Samsung Browser apps are installed even with "Disable system apps" enabled. When creating a device owner KME profile with the Disable system apps policy enabled, the Samsung Email and Browser apps are still installed on the device after the enrollment completes. Cause The Samsung Email and Samsung Browser apps are not considered system apps, so selecting Disable system apps does not prevent them from being installed on the device. Resolution This is expected behavior. KME device owner enrollment skips the setup wizard screens, where the user is prompted to download the apps. Therefore, the KME agent installs both apps by default so they do not need to be deployed manually. Workaround If you don't want these apps on your devices, you can use your MDM's policies to block the app packages from launching. Please consult your MDM's documentation on its application blocking features. The package names are listed below: Samsung Email - `com.samsung.android.email.provider`, Samsung Internet Browser - `com.sec.android.app.sbrowser`

sections.title: Profile and device country do not match in Knox Mobile Enrollment
sections.content: Profile and device country do not match in Knox Mobile Enrollment. You may encounter an issue where your profile and device countries do not match, preventing Knox Configure (KC) and Knox Mobile Enrollment (KME) from starting enrollment. Cause Currently, there are two Knox Mobile Enrollment (KME) servers globally in the US and EU, as well as three KC servers globally in the US, EU and China. One server is dedicated to devices in the Americas, while the second server is for devices in the EU and the rest of the world. The servers are hosted through Amazon Web Services (AWS) in the US (for North/Central/South America and the Caribbean), and in Ireland (for all countries except for China and the Americas). Based on the country you select during Samsung Knox registration, your KME/KC Admin account is linked to the appropriate server. For example, if you selected US as your country during KME/KC registration, then only devices from the Americas can be enrolled through this account. Resolution To enroll devices from another region, you must create a second KME/KC admin account at SamsungKnox.com and select the corresponding country. For KC, you must have separate licenses to enroll devices in both US and EU consoles, as a KC license can only be tied to one account at a time.

sections.title: Service provider update interrupts the KME enrollment process
sections.content: Service provider update interrupts the KME enrollment process. Some users may encounter an issue with the service provider update for True Single SKU (TSS) devices. Learn about TSS setup, and how to resolve the issue. New True Single SKU devices require a one-time restart to complete the setup process. Customers using these devices in conjunction with Knox Mobile Enrollment have reported experiencing an issue where the enrollment data isn't passed to their chosen EMM after the restart. Due to this behavior, the device user must manually intervene. What is True Single SKU? When you purchase a new Galaxy device, it will come pre-loaded with network-specific features and services, depending on where the device has been purchased from. This is because most devices have a specific service provider or SKU that indicates which network they are connected to. With True Single SKU, new devices have a common service provider. This means that when the device is set up, it will determine what service provider is being used and apply the specific service provider SKU. True Single SKU devices will connect to a server during the initial setup to get information about the service provider. After setup has finished, the device will restart to apply the network specific features and services. Cause During SKU setup, the device restarts, which can interrupt the Knox Mobile Enrollment flow, which in turn prevents vital enrollment data from passing to your EMM. Resolution The device setup process has been updated to complete the service provider update after the TSS setup. The following is the setup process order: 1. Begin enrolling the device through Knox Mobile Enrollment. 2. After the device is connected to a Wi-Fi APN, the True Single SKU setup begins. 3. When prompted, restart the device. 4. Complete device enrollment with Knox Mobile Enrollment. If the service provider update is interrupted during the True Single SKU setup, the wizard notifies you. One possible error message is: > There was a problem connecting. Service provider features will be set up later when your phone is able to connect. After an interruption, if you proceed through the on-screen instructions, you're presented with the option on the home screen to postpone the setup by tapping Remind in 30 minutes. Postponing it allows Knox Mobile Enrollment to complete device enrollment, without any interruptions.

sections.title: How to change the support information displayed on the Knox Mobile Enrollment device splash screen
sections.content: How to change the support information displayed on the Knox Mobile Enrollment device splash screen. This article guides you through the steps on how to change the support information displayed on the end user devices during the KME enrollment process. How do I change the support information displayed on the Knox Mobile Enrollment device splash screen? You can change the company name, address, and support contact details that are displayed to users while initiating enrollment with Knox Mobile Enrollment by following the steps below. 1. Sign in to SamsungKnox.com with the super admin of the account. 2. From the Knox Dashboard, select the Knox Mobile Enrollment tile. 3. From the KME console, in the top right corner, click on the circular account ID icon. 4. Select Manage services & preferences. 5. On the following page, under the Knox Mobile Enrollment subheader, select DEFAULT SUPPORT INFORMATION. 6. On this page, you can change the company name, address, and support email/telephone number.

sections.title: Knox Mobile Enrollment stops installing Samsung Internet & Samsung Email apps
sections.content: Knox Mobile Enrollment stops installing Samsung Internet & Samsung Email apps. In the past, Samsung Internet and Samsung Email apps were preloaded to all Galaxy devices. EMMs have provided management features for these apps based on this. However, some customers are reporting that their devices stopped preloading these two apps. This caused an issue where certain APIs such as BrowserPolicy and EmailPolicy are returning errors when those apps don't exist in the device. To manage this, KME clients are installing the apps during the out-of-box KME enrollment process if they are not preloaded in the device. What has changed? Many EMMs and customers have been installing and managing these apps via Managed Google Play instead of integrating Knox APIs and using them for app management. Since there are fewer and fewer customers who benefit from this feature, KME will be deprecating it on devices with Android 11 or higher via the September 1st, 2021 release. This will remove the auto-install of the apps and reduce KME enrollment time. After the update, if you want to manage Samsung Internet or Samsung Email apps, you can install and manage them via Managed Google Play. For the following models, you can install them via the Galaxy Store or use other 3rd party emails/browser apps: Galaxy A12, Galaxy A21s, Galaxy M12/F12, Galaxy M31s, Galaxy M51, Galaxy Tab A7, and Galaxy Tab A7 Lite.

sections.title: Work Profile Not Created for Successful DO (WPC) Enrollments
sections.content: Work Profile Not Created for Successful DO (WPC) Enrollments. Users using KME to enroll devices with a DO (WP-C) MDM profile are experiencing an issue where the work profile is not being created, but the enrollment is completed without any errors. Cause In Android 11, Google made many changes in order to protect user privacy on company-owned devices. One of the changes was the replacement of the device management mode called fully managed device with a work profile with a new work profile on company-owned device. This profile type requires a certain configuration of the KME profile. If the KME profile configuration is incorrect, then the work profile will fail to be created. Resolution During the KME Android Enterprise (DO) profile creation, there are 2 options: 1. Force Device Owner enrollment 2. Let MDM choose to enroll as a Device Owner or Profile Owner. !Options available for KME android Enterprise profile creation If you are enrolling in a WP-C MDM profile, please ensure that Let MDM choose to enroll as a Device Owner or Profile Owner is selected. If Force Device Owner enrollment is selected, the provisioning mode is automatically set to PROVISIONING_MODE_FULLY_MANAGED_DEVICE (DO without a work profile) instead of PROVISIONING_MODE_MANAGED_PROFILE (WPC). Additional Information To learn more about the different device management modes in Android 11, see the Knox Platform for Enterprise admin guide.

sections.title: Error when registering for a Reseller Portal account due to existing Knox cloud service accounts
sections.content: Error when registering for a Reseller Portal account due to existing Knox cloud service accounts. If you have an existing KME or KC account, you might encounter an error when you sign up for a Reseller Portal account. Cause If you have a KME or KC account, you can't use the same email address used for those accounts to sign up for the Reseller Portal. Resolution During registration for the Reseller Portal, make sure to provide a different email address than the one you used for your KME or KC accounts.

sections.title: Your account has been suspended for security reasons error message
sections.content: Your account has been suspended for security reasons error message. You might encounter an error that states that your account has been suspended for security reasons when you try and sign in with your KME account. Cause This error can occur when there is a problem with your user account. The Samsung support team will need to investigate to resolve the issue. Resolution Please submit a support ticket and include the email address of your KME account.

sections.title: Error when creating an IBM MaaS360 profile
sections.content: Error when creating an IBM MaaS360 profile. When creating an IBM MaaS360 Android Enterprise profile with Knox Mobile Enrollment, the profile creation fails with the error: ```markdown Could not create the profile. ``` Cause The APK for the IBM MaaS360 agent requires schema V3 signature signing. This feature is not currently supported in Knox Mobile Enrollment. Resolution A fix for this issue has been on February 1, 2023. MaaS360 profiles can now be created as outlined in the IBM Knox Mobile Enrollment guide. Workaround This workaround is now deprecated, as a fix was released. If this workaround was used, the Knox Mobile Enrollment profile can be edited to use the preset MaaS360 profile, instead of Other. New enrollments will use the updated profile, but prior enrollments aren't affected unless a factory reset is issued to the device To create an IBM MaaS360 Android Enterprise profile: 1. Create a profile in Knox Mobile Enrollment. 2. Under Pick your MDM, select Other. 3. For MDM agent APK, enter https://dl.maas360.com/nafo/cdn-content/agents/android/MaaS360Android.apk. The Knox Mobile Enrollment team is working on a future software update with V3 signing support for KME. Currently, there is no fixed release timeline.

sections.title: Device reverts to personal device when cancelling EMM enrollment setup
sections.content: Device reverts to personal device when cancelling EMM enrollment setup. When enrolling a device in Microsoft Intune through Knox Mobile Enrollment, device users are able to cancel the enrollment process at any point in the Setup Wizard by tapping Cancel setup. Upon cancelling enrollment, the device then configures itself as a personal device. Cause When cancelling enrollment, the Reset and return device screen in the Setup Wizard isn't triggered, and the device reverts to an unenrolled state. This issue arises due to the way Android manages provisioning and occurs even for customers not using Knox Mobile Enrollment. This issue has been reported to Google. Workaround Currently, Samsung is working to change the aforementioned enrollment behavior. With the 23.03 release, when the device user taps Cancel setup in the Setup Wizard, they are asked to confirm before resetting the device. Upon resetting, the enrollment process starts over. The confirmation screen for work profile enrollment. The confirmation screen for fully managed enrollment.

sections.title: How to set up firewall exception for True Single SKU devices
sections.content: How to set up firewall exception for True Single SKU devices. When you purchase a new Galaxy device, it comes pre-loaded with network-specific features and services depending on where the device was purchased from. The features and services are determined by the specific service provider or SKU indicating which network they are connected to. With True Single SKU, new devices have a common service provider. When the device is set up, its service provider is automatically determined and the specific service provider SKU is applied. True Single SKU devices connect to a server during the initial setup to get information about the service provider. After setup has finished, the device will restart to apply the network-specific features and services. Some Galaxy devices require public internet connection during the initial device setup wizard. The following URL and port number should be whitelisted as a trusted site for enterprises attempting to reach destination Knox servers. This step is required to define the sales code (carrier code) and proceed with the setup steps. Domain - `api.gras.samsungdm.com` Port - 443

sections.title: What is the valid input for Signing Key?
sections.content: What is the valid input for Signing Key?. By default, the EMM agent signature checksum or the signing key is auto-populated based on the chosen EMM provider. Optionally, you can add another application or a new device configuration. Knox Service Plugin (KSP) must be configured for your EMM in order to apply a new device configuration. For KSP: Package name: `com.samsung.android.knox.kpu` KSP App package signing key: NN8Oep8c8YkuRcBWtJc82BzPFIpAUNEa6krFpl-QCkI= To deploy an additional app using KME Direct, click ADD A NEW APP and enter the App Package name, App package signing key, and App package download URI for the app download. There are multiple ways to get the signing key for additional applications. The Admin package signature checksum is the Base64 encoded SHA-256 hash of the MDM APK signature, which is URL friendly. You can get this value from your MDM. Go here for information on the `EXTRA_PROVISIONING_DEVICE_ADMIN_SIGNATURE_CHECKSUM`. Alternatively, you can use utilities such as keytool on Linux to get this value. For additional information, go here.

sections.title: Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct Detailed Step-by-Step Setup Guide
sections.content: Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct Detailed Step-by-Step Setup Guide. Download a detailed step-by-step guide on KME Direct setup. Click here to open

sections.title: EMM enrollment fails when using QR code method
sections.content: EMM enrollment fails when using QR code method. When a device user in China enrolls a device in an EMM using a QR code from Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct, they might encounter an error after scanning the code where the EMM agent fails to download and install. The following error then displays on the device: > Error > > Couldn't enroll your phone because there are missing files necessary for enrollment. Contact Support if the problem continues. Cause The hosting servers that EMMs use to provide app downloads aren't always available or accessible in China. When the device user scans the QR code to download the EMM agent, the link in the QR code might not be reachable. For example, if the QR code consists of the following URI: https://discovery.awmdm.com/mobileenrollment/airwatchagent.apk The final URI will be https://www.vmware.com/content/dam/getwsone/download.html, and the automatic installation fails. Resolution You must generate the QR code based on the URI that's actually accessible from the China region. Device users can use this QR code to successfully enroll their device. There are several methods to find the correct URI: Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct has preset URIs for some EMMs. When editing the EMM agent URI field, URI suggestions will autocomplete based on your input. These URIs will work with your network. You can also test the URI in your local environment. You can store the EMM agent package on your own server and provide your own URI for EMM deployment. If enrollment continues to fail, please contact b2b.china@samsung.com. Additional information To learn about device deployment profiles in Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct, refer to the Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct IT admin guide.

sections.title: How to deploy fully managed devices in China
sections.content: How to deploy fully managed devices in China. Some regions don't support work profile and shared enrollment modes for Android devices. Learn how to instead enroll them in fully managed mode with Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct. For devices purchased in China running region-based firmware, the following deployment methods are not supported: Zero-touch enrollment, Knox Mobile Enrollment For devices running Knox 3.7.1 and higher, Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct is supported for Android Enterprise deployments, and can be used to deploy to devices purchased in China with region-based firmware. How to deploy fully managed devices with Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct First, install Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct from https://www.samsungknox.cn: 1. Sign in to https://www.samsungknox.cn. 2. Click KME Direct. 3. Download and install Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct. Next, create and deploy a device profile: 1. Create a deployment profile with Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct. 2. Deploy the profile to the device. For further support with Knox Mobile Enrollment Direct, contact b2b.china@samsung.com.
